-S2ax6eCvFYynquXsLPT4A.text: The other night we visited Killington's in Baxter Village for the first time and we can't wait to go back.  This place advertises itself as a gastro pub with high quality food and that description fits this place perfectly.  We started off with the Portabella Napoleon which was absolutely amazing. A layered treat of portabella mushroom topped with red peppers, goat cheese and zucchini literally had our mouths buzzing with flavor. Dinner for us consisted of the Baxter chicken entree as well as the Salmon PLT sandwich. The chicken was tender and juicy covered in mozzarella and roasted red pepper over mashed potatoes The salmon sandwich was equally delicious and even the bread was amazing, as it was toasted and had some type of mustard sauce layered underneath it. Even the sauteed spinach on the side was fabulous. Top this off with great service and a nice craft beer selection and that makes for one very nice dining experience.  Simply a top shelf restaurant at a great price point!

v7QLHq5lP1g7qO2Rb9q7wA.text: Horribly slow service, just not worth it. Waiting over 30 mins to be seated & then another 40 mins for food. Food just average

C1noPLblcAvK2dE3Y9aP5g.text: First time last night. Love the renovations. Much cleaner and sleeker and QUIETER!  Friendly service. And the food. Mr. Bill had the pork chop. Loved it. Came with asparagus and grits-which we're yummy till they cooled down. I had pub fish and chips. Absolutely delicious. Even the fries were great. You know it's prepared properly when leftovers the next day are still great! We will be back!

a1wZ8-_D8WKYXmWl54Lt8w.text: GREAT Manager! We have eaten here a few times, and have settled in on the Mahi Caesar wrap. The other day, the fries weren't to our liking (I NEVER complain about food). I approached the manager and he was very kind and accommodating. Cooked new fries, brought them out, and decided the seasoning wasn't to HIS liking. Took them back, perfected them, and we were happy in the end.  Food is great. NEEDS A HAPPY HOUR!   UPDATE: Went back for the fourth time and the fries were still cold and soggy. Now the good experience is the exception, and we will give them a few months to get things straight instead of the once per week visits we were making.

sv3riNIhA3K_2-l4adVzHA.text: I am so excited this place is here. Privately owned. And the food was magnificent. Bartender was very good, friendly and on the ball. My only complaint is the draft beer is very expensive. They will need to get that down to survive. Great location. And the food again was fabulous.

XkYns-AFAeP6-4Pwx0OT8w.text: The food is delicious. My husband said the beef tenderloin was the best he's ever had. The black bean burger is flavorful and not dry. The restaurant is still working out some kinks in their operations. When we were there, they had 2 cooks call out so the kitchen was slow. They provided free apps and reduced our bill due to the wait which was extremely generous. They'll get there and this place will easily be one of our favorite local dinner places.

SGqtckM7j93WdZHBO6xSRA.text: We absolutely LOVE this place. The menu has endless options and we love the casual atmosphere. We are a younger family and often times it's difficult to find a place that accommodates our needs/wants without sacrificing something, that is definitely not the case here! We've been countless times and continue to be impressed, we also appreciate that when they are busy we've been given the heads up that we can be seated and grab apps and drinks but food may be a little delayed. Again, this is awesome for us and wish more places were upfront. We've found our go to and it never disappoints, it's so nice to have a family owned/local spot that supports the community as well. We've also had the owners stop off at our table on numerous occasions. I just cannot say enough about this place!

VHwlxb6s3VX2kP49I5sPdA.text: This is one of my family's favorite restaurants!  The menu is great and we all have several things on the menu we love (my daughter especially loves the Honey Mustard).  The servers are always friendly, my husband loves the beer selection and the food always comes out right on time!  If you are looking for a good family restaurant or better yet a date night or night with friends I would definitely recommend Killingtons!!!

pxypfYUPEV-5aJYbEi9zBA.text: Amazing food. Amazing prices. Chefs Special dishes never disappoint. Definitely my new favorite hot spot in Baxter village! Keep it up guys!

No3qr-7lfCsnqm5XrJmAAA.text: Have gone to this restaurant two times in the last 6 months with my in-laws and my parents. Both times waited a very long time, and eventually walked out. Last time they told me 30 minutes, and I left after waiting over an hour. My wife told me before we left I was stupid to try it again.... but I did not listen. We used to go all the time when it was Beef o Brady, but have yet to be to this restaurant yet, and now never will. Both times we had 7 people. They said we had to wait for a booth... the 2 they had had 3 people and 2 people sitting in them while they had open 4 person booths and tables. They offered a high top table, but had an 18 month old kid. NEVER AGAIN!

XzicxqMa5wZDldH8n7PQ1g.text: Great addition to Baxter and the area!  Great family and friends environment and a much needed improvement over the former restaurant that occupied their space. The menu is large with a lot to choose from. The duck items are delicious!!  Love that they have local craft beer on tap and a good selection of cocktails. Looking forward to trying more items on the menu!

0M8nllzODDK_xgvaqxbJVg.text: I went to Killington's a few months ago with a large group. The restaurant was packed and the service & food were spectacular.  Went last light with my husband and while the service was still very good, the quality of the food was lacking. My husband got the Cuban with creamed spinach. The creamed spinach was good, however the Cuban was below average. I got a French Dip & asparagus. The roast beef was tough and dry, the provolone cheese was already waxy by the time it reached my table- an indication that It had been made a while before served. Part of the roll was burned.  Both side portions were very small.  I hope our experience was an anomaly, but judging by the sparse crowd for a Saturday night, I have to wonder. We might give this place a try in the future, but I'll be watching YELP for some positive reviews before we chance it.

Y_OOPrvHYMuZK-eUBF_cqw.text: Went in with some colleagues for Happy Hour drinks and appetizers.  They don't have Happy Hour.  I had two drafts and with tip the bill was over $15.00!  I have never paid that much for two Old Meck Coppers anywhere.  I wanted to try the food but paying $7.50 each for a draft I have no plans to go back.

DLbS0--RL9ls0JWH8awgLg.text: **Updated review to reflect more recent visits: I've been back at least 4 times - usually after the rush but every time (except 1 brunch) the food has taken so long that it's tarnished our view of the place. One visit we waited about an hour after ordering and came to find out our food hadn't even gone in yet - I will not blame the kitchen because they do get backed up but I will put blame on the management because when your kitchen is backed up that much you need to empower your wait staff to do whatever they can to keep those waiting content - whether it be a complimentary salad or appetizer. Another visit we had been there a while (again, very long wait for food) and we just wanted to get out of there and our waitress was nowhere to be found and we needed change. So I asked another waitress if she could break a $20 and instead of taking the time to help out her team, she declined to help and instead pointed me to the bar to do it myself. That's not how you build a loyal customer base. I haven't been back since and will probably be a while before I go back. Still one of the best burgers in the area though.**  I ordered the gastro pub burger with mashed potatoes and an extra side of grits. No lie, this burger almost brought tears to my eyes it was so good. Tender, juicy and very creative - some sort of cheesy sauce vs slice of cheese and the bacon w pickles is a dream. Easily top 3 burgers, maybe best I've ever had. The mashed potatoes were dry and not creamy which because of the burgers I gave them a pass, I wouldn't get them again though. Not amazing. The grits - I hate grits but my wife wanted them - super gooooood.   She had a black bean burger - she's a veggie & fish eater. I think she's over black bean patties because they're overall crumbly and dry, and it's not like you're eating a veggie burger, you're still very much eating beans. So she prefers a veggie patty.   Well because of my burger euphoria we are definitely going back and there were a few things she was looking forward to trying some other things. Oh! Super nice servers and staff, very great people. Pretty chill ambiance - nothing to write home about. Wish they took reservations. They're always packed (which good for them :D)

lxMIpk7sawx-1DOs_Vm5yg.text: Food is just okay - nothing to write home about. We've been a few times and the best thing has been ravioli. Overpriced for not much flavor  - especially the kids meals.

67TyNypyGDfH0xwwA9sTmw.text: This was our first visit to this new restaurant and we were very pleased.  The service was great, and our food came out in a reasonable time.  The restaurant was definitely kid friendly toward our 3 year old and 6 year old.  There is a good variety on the menu, and the food was delicious and a large portion size.  We will definitely be going back!

7g3AaSchi7RoxDAcN-1wDw.text: Excellent food and service. My husband and I wanted to give them a try. Hard to find good places to eat with fresh  ingredients in a variety of options. I started off with a bloody Mary. Excellent. We ordered the pretzel but they didn't want to bring us the original one they had made because it broke. Our manager said it was all about the presentation. So we received a gorgeous pretzel with very yummy pimento cheese spread and hot mustard. My husband got the Baxter chicken which was absolutely amazing and then I ordered the cast iron beef tenderloin. I asked for a medium cook but when  I received it it was closer to well done. normally I would send this back but it had a very good flavor. Within a few minutes the manager came out with a brand new meal for me and said he thought that it looked over cooked.  They replaced my meal even though I did not complain. I've been incredibly impressed with the fantastic service. The attention to detail. And the willingness to make something right even when customers don't acknowledge. We will be back.

iTkpkeRabIR6USyJLDnBOA.text: Love that they are bringing back the outdoor bands!! Food is average, have tried both brunch and dinner.. come here more for atmosphere but recommend!

MofWGZ970HQM_VRYxZoLIA.text: Food was good not great. Place is a lot nicer than Beef O Brady's. Nice atmosphere and pleasant staff. Decent menu. Will go back.

1VuQ8Vp1GSBZ6_0ADj5alg.text: Hands down the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant.  Started with a 30 minute wait.  No big deal, it's a Friday night.  They take your phone number and promise to call when it's your time.  Lies.  We went next door for a pre-dinner drink and after waiting about 30 minutes I decide to check in on the wait.  They're a bakers dozen amount of parties ahead of us.  Never called.  After a panicked scramble to get our party of 3 a table we end up "downstairs" where everyone is served by a quasi-bartender who has way too much going on.  Supposedly we're going to get a free appetizer but I'm not optimistic.  Takes some time before we can even get a drink order in.  Get the kid milk - she delivers one of those grade school 8oz cartons from 1989.  Did we order a happy meal?  Order food, get asked how I want my pork chop cooked.  Uhh, without trichinosis please. If it's delivered.  20 minutes later still waiting on that "free" appetizer.  While we wait we watch the party of 7 adjacent to us get each dinner served individually spaced 2-3 minutes apart.  It would be entertaining if it wasn't so sad on a basic how to operate a restaurant level.   So at about the 30 minute or so mark (an hour and a half after first arriving) we get our appetizer, sans plates - who need plates.  Those need another 5 minutes to prep.  Once that's in order we have the pleasure of cutting into some stuffed banana peppers that have clearly been under a heat lamp since about 4 minutes after we ordered them.  And,to be expected at this point, prior to finishing the appetizer the meal arrives (in stages - they bring the kid's dinner last - excellent thinking).  Her chicken is described as "chewy" ... his pork chop is thankfully cooked through but lacking flavor.  The kid gave a negative head shake when asked if his pasta was good. Yikes.  And at the end they tried to charge us for that free appetizer.  Needless to say, never ever shall we return.

uDkbsVegZ3MU56k3VaYxsQ.text: First visit for Panthers game. Sat at the bar . Bartender excellent. Great beer selection. Appetizer, stuffed banana peppers had more heat than expected but was excellent. Recommend side of balsamic for a perfect combo of warmth, salty and sweet. First visit excellent and yes the pricing is not fast food but neither is the service or food. Will be back. A great addition to Baxter.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

VCmX2fKgAjmD6F3ZNO53Kg.text: Went tonight for the 1st we drove by n figured we would check it out. It wasn't very busy more then a few open tables at 1st the hostess said she can can seat us right away then was told kitchen was behind n it would be about 10 mins. So about 20-30 mins later we sat.  Waitress was good n friendly.  Ordered a Bloody Mary asked for kettle one n god only knows what kind of cheap rack vodka was used it was nasty. Ordered the salmon n it was over cooked fishy tasting   Didn't finish anything that was order. The best thing was the pretzel app n that was ok at best. Definitely won't be back

fXqI0C-nmlRMnGAd-bMPrw.text: This was our first time at Killingtons. Girls drinks after work. No drink specials despite the fact they have been open a while. Waitress said they haven't been given permission to do that yet. No appetizer specials either! Those not regulated by liquor board though! Two beers and appetizer to split and it was $23 with tip! Yikes! Not on this teacher salary! Beef o'Bradys that was in this space before had drink specials! These girls will be looking for another watering hole. Prices too steep for us.

r4TnLdArTnlY8ZChso23Iw.text: Disappointed from start to finish. We tried it out tonight since my wife loved the one in Huntersville. Came in to a 10 minute wait in a restaurant that was 60% filled. (I know why it was only at 60% now!) We were then seated at a wet table. We both ordered the Dip sandwich, she chose the cucumber salad as a side that she stated was okay. I opted for "sad" asparagus (see photo). She also ordered the tomato bisque. Also rated as okay by her. She did love the grapefruit Flirtini. I ordered a hefeweizen which after a sip I knew was an IPA. I told the individual that brought our meals that I had ordered a hefeweizen and this was not one. She said she would tell our waitress. Then I am told they ran out of the hefeweizen. Then seeing that 2 sandwiches, a cup of soup and 1 cocktail were over $35 without tip I think this place will not be seeing me again. I feel I could have had a better meat at Jason's Deli.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Sad excuse for asparagus the sandwich was okay.

2f9hTNQ-2EBh9zQfprxVUw.text: My husband and I LOVE this place.  Our favorite thing is to sit at the bar and Cindy will greet you with a smile!  She is there every weekend and always provides tasty cocktails and wonderful service.  The meatloaf is a must along with their grits and any Benedict.  Saturday's are bottomless mimosas!!  Great food and service!!

6O44HDUAiknlCMk2ev81GQ.text: First off, the service that we received from our waiter, Dan, was fantastic!  He was cordial and checked in on us as needed.  I would give a 5 if rating on service alone.  The food on the other hand was very meh.  This was our second visit after the first where food was also meh.  I got a black-bean burger and side salad.  The portion was big, but it got to me lukewarm and the side salad was wilty and old.  My daughter got the mac n cheese, which was just plain old kraft blue box, and it was also lukewarm.  I think if you were going for just drinks, this is the place to be, but it's very pricey for not great food.

_FKOuspkXA6ZggzLrwAZXQ.text: Pros: it's good food for the area.  The dinner menu has a lot of options.  They make pretty good cocktails.    Cons: it can get very crowded.  The hostess tends to be inexperienced with crowds and big parties. There is no other menu but dinner. Good luck finding something small for lunch.   For the area it's good.

Ur3sJ2vshmSGQ5pvJn9I1g.text: Went with a few co-workers yesterday. Nice ambiance and overall seating arrangement. The pretzel was delicious, as were the wings we ordered. However, the Wings could use a little more flavor variety, and there weren't enough beer selections. Overall, would visit again.

H2b49S3ritqf0PzQktLcxg.text: My family and I tried this restaurant last night and we absolutely loved it! All of us moaned through our meals the entire time... We loved all of our appetizers from the stuffed peppers to the fried raviolis... The kids loved that there were two different menus to choose from, Junior and kids menus... I had the Baxter chicken which was absolutely amazing! We very rarely order dessert out but for some reason we did last night and it was exceptional! We ordered the blueberry cheesecake, peanut butter pie and a brownie sundae... There were 11 of us by the way! Everything was fantastic can't wait to go back :)

O74gHT0f_F7QDGwxn0rc7g.text: My coworkers and i ate their for lunch and i wasn't impressed, the Gouda Mac and cheese was hard and not gooey as i thought it would be, however the bacon wrapped meatloaf sandwich was great especially with the garlic bread. I would try it again but just not the Mac and cheese

Ob3MZhdPrBsGGe1Hk4XpWA.text: First, the constant 80's hit (=not good) music just grinds you down. Been twice, same both times. Change it up.   Anything is better than Beefs so we really wanted to like it. Staff, wait times and everything else non-food related (except the crap music) was great. The food I hate to say was just average. The calamari soaked in some Asian sauce was fair but not expected. And only rings with thick breading and no octopus tentacle-looking parts was unexpected. I shoulda read the description - that's on me. Still, not very good. Mrs and I ordered burgers. Medium usually means some pink - ours were thoroughly overcooked. And the buns were McDonalds grade. My son got the ribs and besides hardly any sauce, they had no flavor. On the plus side, the fries were good.   Maybe this is just them finding their groove and things will improve. Suggestions: ditch the awful 80's Pandora station. Cook meat to temp ordered. Find a new bun vendor. Ditch the macrobrews served at Applebee's and find some more local stuff. And throw in a few appetizers under $10 because none exist.

49nkMI1mnJF5tXgE6B9suw.text: Garbage food with terrible service. My wife and I were very excited for this place to open up near our home and give it a try, but we were extremely disappointed. After promptly checking in two guests before us, the hostess rudely dismissed us. We decided to sit outside for dinner and waited 10 minutes for our drinks to come in ($7 for a Guinness?! Are you kidding me?). We got our food 45 minutes later although we ordered immediately once we got our initial drinks. By the way, fish and chips are called fish and chips and not "pub fish". Overall, Killingtons is overpriced, lack luster, and disappointing.

oAxGSdlbsRyfPVapgank_Q.text: This was our first time here. The whole place is brand new, great atmosphere. The menu is very diverse. The Fried Ravioli appetizer was very good, but the stuffed banana peppers were odd. Not bad, they had a strange filling. I had the chicken sandwich. The chicken was tender and had good flavor. What really made our trip worth while was our server Mieyah. She was very friendly, attentive, and she gave us good recommendations. She was always moving, making sure everyone was taken care of without forgetting us. We will be back!

2jINN5vaXITLz8xwNI2LLw.text: We went 1st week opened so planned on a rough go as most new places have, we had 11 people, we were sat promptly, place looks great, manager stopped by......drink servers were slow, but improved as evening went on, apps were all excellent, entrees were also excellent, we all swapped around and really enjoyed everything....except my wifes burger and hash...was good, but found a pretty good sized hair in it....server was prompt to respond with a replacement...(did not offer to comp her meal as most would have though-and generally a manager would have stopped by to apologize).....overall serious promise, great food choices, and great food, well except the hair....make sure your staff if using hairnets.....

FVAS4XBSGXH8ao-BKvSSfg.text: I travel almost every week from Florida to Fort Mill.  I've tried several restaurants in the area and Killingtons is my go to place.  The food is generous and good....everything.   I generally sit at the bar and Jodi always greets you with a smile.  Her recommendations are excellent and she knows her beer, wine, and spirits well.  Great ambience,  excellent service.....what more do you need.

A8uIlcLTF7Q2NUMw-EZd6w.text: I've lived in Baxter for 15 years and enjoyed the previous restaurant, Beef O Brady's for what it was...a family sports restaurant / pub.  Killingtons is a step up for sure.   Decent date night place.  I had the pork chop and the wife had Steak in the Grass.   Both tasty and well presented.  The staff seemed young but they were ok.   Prices were commensurate with the quality.  I'd definitely return.

SLfNplKXLjhsZ4oJV0tfrA.text: Dinner time has a wait during the weekend but you can walk right in during a week night before 6:30.  I'm always looking for something different on a menu...tired of chicken sandwiches, burgers, salmon, shrimp and grits etc. etc. I LOVE the smoked duck wrap and get it every time. Never disappointed! Last week I ordered a martini...the best ever with 3 large olives and the price was $7.50.  People complain about the beer prices...order the martini instead! Our server was terrific and the food came super fast. On the whole, a great local restaurant with a varied menu at reasonable entree prices.

4DbhcN1aLKwuSFfnEHd01w.text: Hunter was awesome.  Great food.  Awesome personality.  She was really great with advice and short convo.   Very quick.

KHh-cHqNueQ23NXwv-ApBA.text: This place is very good I love how they have a kids menu and a junior menu and my absolute favorite is the junior kids steak with asparagus it is so yummy and then my favorite appetizer is probably going to have to be the chili if you had to pick something this is what it would be I love this so much just the one thing is is that some of their stuff is a little how do I say it a little on edge the squid is not the best it kind of was very chewy and it didn't have very much flavor I kind of just tasted like hibachi it was a little bit overpriced but not too much I thought that it was a good amount of money for what I was getting some other people at my table there just was a little risky but I thought my overall was very good and I didn't have anything to complain about with what I had to eat so if you stick with what I got then you would have a really good meal

zJ2rKD7r6scShKOuKf1RKQ.text: Killington's is great! I've been twice. Service has always been great and food is amazing. The shrimp and grits are very good. Peanut butter pie is delicious. Both times I've been there, management has stopped by our table and been very present. I'm so glad to have this option in the area.

exmtsIncXY54Z37pusAHGw.text: I never made it to Beef O'Brady's, but the fella said they'd changed the inside around a little. What used to be a private dining/karaoke room now appears to be general seating, so it's a good size, and it took awhile for them to be on a wait on a Wednesday evening. There are also two different bars with seating.  Service was pretty darn great - our waitress was spot on (until she disappeared while we waited for our check), and two different managers came over to check in on us.  We started with the duck spring rolls, which were tasty, especially the sauce. For dinner, the fella got the pub fish fry, and I got the Baxter chicken. Both were solid! We're also pretty excited that they're open for brunch on Sundays. The menu for brunch and dinner appear to be the exact same as the Huntersville location. The fella was a little underwhelmed with their beer choices (he's a craft beer nerd), but he found a couple of things, and my wine was delicious.  Overall, this seems like a great addition to Baxter - salads, sandwiches, and entrees in the $9 - $20 range and more elevated than your standard bar fare. Six Pence had better look out!

0xFkWAZfp6wtSkCsDKQgMg.text: The menu is great, but service has been subpar. We've been several times and have waited well over 30 mins after ordering for food, and have constantly had to waive a server over for any assistance, as they don't check in often.   With that said, the menu is varied and the food is consistently good. Meatloaf Benedict is awesome!

Garo0rxGju3mwFvPeAvHWw.text: This has become one of our go to restaurants in Fort Mill. We love the variety of the menu. My favorite is the meatloaf sandwich. And my sons favorite is the steak salad. I've never had a bad meal and the staff is very attentive.

JDFLw0BHBzIKv6A27POQlQ.text: Comprised of smoked duck, jicama slaw, fried onions, sliced pickles, & molasses Dijon BBQ sauce all in a garlic herb wrap. A lot going on here.. while this was a really great wrap, I do have a couple of nit-picky comments.. Would I know this was duck if the description didn't say it, probably not. The fried onions I love, but don't really help here. The jicama slaw is flawless and the pickles were very tasty and added a nice crunch and acidity. I love that the duck was smoked here, but I thought it might still have that ducky goodness, but here it was like a really tender chicken. Overall it was tasty! The chips are yummy homemade chips fried to perfection and well seasoned! Looking forward to trying more food from here.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. This is he &#34;Smoked Duck Wrap&#34; w/ homemade chips.

-Sae65QtAWZg7GTYlbKinQ.text: Good selection of food & drinks...service has always been pleasant. Fairly priced restaurant in a family oriented neighborhood!

V7BUMvUS29OA1HP_yJws7A.text: I've been to this restaurant 4 times. I always order the burger. (Loved it) Last night we went with another couple. It was late so we ordered the special  Chicken  Parmesan. It was chicken Parmesan over mushroom ravioli, marinara sauce served with garlic bread. It was the most delicious way I've ever had Chicken Parmesan We all were so happy with our choice. Now I'm anxious to try the rest of the menu. Service is always great  plus the apple pie is to die for.

2Z2SrQzkoyqgSNRPe1WT3A.text: Food is a little different, a little higher class bar food at an ok price.. staff was nice

qRkduP9pNsYXz1nwqpiD4A.text: We were seated immediately by the hosts, but the booth looked like it wasn't cleaned very well after the previous customer. Our waitress, Megan, was friendly and attentive throughout our meal. The food was average. We ordered a burger, salad, and loaded chips as an appetizer. The chips were slightly burned and lacked flavor. I was happy with the salad as it was fresh (not soggy like some places) and the chicken was crispy. The burger was average.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

O-yt4erR5-p6aC-xn7B5cA.text: We, as a family, really enjoy going to Killingtons. We have tried several things just so that we could sample each others dishes and we have yet to be disappointed. We have tried the Gastro Pub burger, steak salad, a couple of the specials,  hubby had the steak on two occasions and our youngest really likes their gastro pasta from the kids menu. Jennifer H has served us on two occasions and she is awesome. She ensures that our glasses are always full and she frequently stops by to check in. Oh, the pretzel appetizer is oh, so yummy. Really enjoy having a night out every now and then and when we ask each other where to go, this is one of the top three places to choose from.

ce92-NXYXWRoqTOKxO6A1Q.text: Came in for a quick lunch with a colleague and overall the place is average. We both had salads with a water and a sweet tea and the bill was almost 40 bucks after tip. Service was attentive and friendly.    Killingtons just doesn't justify the cost with so many other options around.  They need to consider knocking a buck off their beers and reduce the meals as well or up the quality.  Will probably give it another shot.

nQqUApVcMd57rNRDNeclPg.text: A group of co-workers and I went to Killingtons for a happy hour. We were seated a table in the backroom where I found the atmosphere to be rather pleasant, especially compared to the previous tenants Beef O Brady's.   As a group we ordered a few of the pretzels, which were very good, and a couple large orders of the wings. The wings were above average, but the lack of flavor variety really held them back. We also ordered a few beers and the service on those was pretty slow on a night where the restaurant did not seem to be very busy. I would say the service in general was sub-par and was the only poor experience of an otherwise enjoyable experience.

j9McHU8aNz7HthmXM0QvKQ.text: I had the ribs and they were very moist. Also the service is very good. Must go in Baxter

mMzw3bUNum5wtStV_xevwg.text: From a mom stand point. Great price for a kids meal. $7 hotdog, fries, fruit and a drink. You can't beat that. The food is great. The service was awesome! Makes traveling from a hurricane a little less pricy.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States

DNGPLvb_vkbEMvoLMoeRVg.text: Was pub food, but they've expanded the menu. Great salad, soups, burgers huge.  Worth giving it a try next time you're in Fort Mill, Baxter area. Desert was $8 for apple pie, we passed on that, $5 maybe, but for $8 we went across street to HT bought whole pie

4SGVvn2fbnH7i56yzcgtig.text: These guys rock!! Amazing customer service.  I ordered a meal through Foodsby and it got taken by someone else at my work.  I called them to see if they accidentally forgotten to make it, and even though it was not their fault they decided to remake my meal and drive it over!  We do get togethers at Killigton's all the time for work.  Can't say enough good things.  Thanks again!

BN2xmwPhMC1fq2gPxhgipQ.text: Absolutely the worst experience for brunch we have ever had.  Our food took forever then when it arrives our sausage was raw inside, we let our server know so she switched it out for bacon and even that was equivalent to microwave bacon.  We also ordered the pancakes they came out cold and with no butter and a tiny thing of syrup.  I ordered a mimosa and it tasted spoiled orange juice mixed with cleaner.  The service was slow the food was terrible and the manager didn't seem to concerned with all of the issues, so needless to say we will never be going back!

Bp199cXN9jm58x84gZNzCA.text: This was a 1st time visit, I was killing time so,I kept it simple. I sat at the bar, ordered the loaded chips with a Labatt Blue Light (spent a lot of time in Toronto Canada so for me seeing it on draft in SC was a trip down memory lane). The Experience was pleasant, will return.

oCkqKzhhts9j_-aDxDFgDw.text: Not to good, poor service and subpar food.Wings were not good,Turkey sandwich was not good either.Had a hard time getting  waitress to assist us.

soweUVR_mm1oGhEpUQ9_KA.text: How's about this me and my sister went there and we waited 1 hour was told twice the kitch was backed up but the family that came in 5 min after we did got there food. Howfair is that.

q0gWhwPm37vUkR3AqZkfWA.text: Great food and atmosphere! Hunter was our waitress and she was such a delight. Very attentive and in good spirits. Will be returning!

PzSCs_gMZRyD2ecxLBr-nQ.text: Killington's has been open in Fort Mill for about a year. Tonight was our first time dining there and our experience was great. We had a party of six, including a baby, and every member of the staff was just amazing in a genuinely friendly and not "pushy" or "fake" manner. This was even despite the fact that they were pretty busy with some large parties when we arrived.  The space took over the old Beef O'Brady's location and the decor is more contemporary with dark wood accents and a nicer bar. There are elements of Western New York on the walls since the owners are from there but it is not overkill (thankfully I didn't notice any Bills or Sabres logos). Likewise, the menu has some aspects of Western NY without overdoing it. They have stuffed banana peppers, steak in the grass, fish fry, and of course, wings.  However, there are a lot of other options that range from $10 sandwiches to entrees that are closer to $30 and everything in between.  Three people in our party got the steak in the grass which is an open-faced 6 ounce sandwich with spinach and mozzarella. One got a grilled shrimp salad and I had a pub roast beef sandwich. Most of our orders were slightly customized to due to food sensitivities and everything came out 100 percent as ordered. My french dip was good but the chef's vegetables consisting of broccoli, carrots, and green beans were amazing. They were seasoned with a little bit of garlic and some other seasoning I couldn't place. I would definitely order those again and again.  The food was good and much better than most of the sub-par bar food that Beefs offered. The service really put this over the top though so we look forward to returning as long as they remain consistent.

rOSJQk0yDahBqSYC9SX1mA.text: I got take out. We had the meatloaf with veggies and mash potatoes which I didn't care for. The Guinness ribeye was perfect however the macaroni was dry and tasteless. The cast iron tenderloin was ok lack taste though but not bad corn and beans sides were tasty were good. The loaded fried chips were almost burnt but had a good flavor I will go revisit and dine in and review again.

D3PiKsUvdbbebc89kqwklg.text: I had been to the one in Huntersville years ago and loved it but wasn't sure if this was the same restaurant. My daughter and I decided to try it for lunch on a Friday and were pleasantly surprised. The service was great, and our sandwiches and sides were DELICIOUS. I had the duck wrap but had it out on sourdough; side of risotto. My daughter has a chicken sandwich (I don't remember which!) and the Gouda Mac and cheese. I had wine and she had a cocktail and everything was on par. Really spectacular sandwiches, great service (I think our server was the bartender - she was well versed and professional) I can't wait to come back for dinner!

FTVEkdTcdH0tTdz36R8vkQ.text: I can't comment enough on how much I love Killingtons.  Our company has hosted a few private dinners in their private pub area. Our servers have always been fantastic and I've never been disappointed in the food.The owner, Shannon, goes above and beyond to accommodate me, whether I'm scheduling a large dinner event, or just needing a reservation for a few people. Oh, and if you're looking for something delicious to try, I highly recommend the Black Bean Burger Stack!

OEf9XQVbdykckUoHjfpXew.text: I'm always glad to see a new restaurant in Fort Mill. Killington's replaced the Beef O Brady's in Baxter Village.  We came in for a late dinner on a Saturday night and it wasn't crowded. We were greeted and told we could sit wherever we'd like. We sat in a booth.   The menu has a variety of items from salads to sandwiches, burgers to entrees. I ordered the special which was the prime rib with parmesan green beans and a side salad. Hubby ordered a meatloaf sandwich. The side salad was pretty good. I got the sweet and spicy dressing which was okay. The entree was a good size. The most flavor on the plate were the parmesan green beans. The prime rib was chewy and lacking seasoning. I poured the au jus and some of the horseradish sauce and it was still just okay for me.  Even though it was slow, there was a group of really loud people on the other side of us, but I guess that comes with the later dinner. We just wanted a quiet dinner.  There's a good variety on the menu and I wouldn't mind coming back to try something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Prime Rib and Parmesan Green Beans
Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Meatloaf Sandwich and Fries
Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Side Salad

tJ7OXrBIJVxabC8YimNudw.text: I had not been to Killingtons before very nice place. My friend had her husbands surprise party so We had a set menu with great choices. I ordered the fish an chips an it was huge :) The fish had a great batter to it an crispy fries yum.  They have a separate room in the back has 2 doors so we were able to surprise the guest of honor.  They did a fabulous job on appetizers cheese/meat trays with crackers, chips with a pepper jack queso. If your in baxter village stop in food is great an service amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Surprise

aJF1uc9aw3IQF_31rxjGkA.text: Killington's has a nice atmosphere and good selection of food. I had 2 appetizers while I was there. The massive pretzel and chicken quesadilla were both tasty. The pretzel had not just salt, but poppy seeds and other seeds on it. The chicken quesadilla had cheese and chicken in it and came with lettuce, canned salsa and sour cream. The only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is because the place smelled strong of bathroom cleaning chemicals.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Chicken Quesadilla
Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Pretzel

5VCgT4m9opDsDXIDJlbcKA.text: Our table was so wobbly I thought I was on a candid camera show. The wait staff and owner didn't do anything to try and fix it. Food was ok, typical pub fare. Nothing special, but a large menu so everyone will find something they will enjoy. Don't get the wobbly table!

sHxfy5_4NvK7Y5FeumxFpQ.text: Been here twice and I'm a fan. From the location in the gorgeous Baxter Town Center to the amazing food, this place is one of my favorites for an afternoon date on Sunday with my husband. The mushroom ravioli is like nothing I've ever had before. The only thing keeping me from giving it a five-star rating is the service. While the waitresses do have great personalities, they don't really check back on us between our orders being placed and then served. We needed drink refills something fierce (and even after our food arrived, it still took a little more time for our drinks to get replenished). But, from what I saw, they were also setting up for dinner hours and trying to clean certain spots in the restaurant, so this is pretty forgivable. Overall, I am looking forward to the next visit!

K4yxDpcHn79f3QpP_w7J1A.text: We just tried out Killingtons on Saturday for the Kentucky Derby. We sat at the bar & service was good. I got one of the gluten free options: Beef Tenderloin (with Parmesan green beans & sweet potato hash). No complaints here! My friend got a chicken sandwich of some kind & thought it was a bit over cooked. The prices were reasonable & our bartender even learned how to make mint juleps for us to drink while watching the derby. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Beef tenderloin, Parmesan green beans &amp; sweet potato hash (gluten free)

5G5NAviI3Pzfm-WjA_53Rg.text: Good experience and really enjoyed the Fish'n Chips. Friendly service, good wine and beer selection. Kids menu has plenty of choices. Will be returning soon.

uF3ThmLWx5DaL8UVFGKX_w.text: Taking a break from shopping and roaming around Fort Mill, we stopped in for a snack and drink.  Mostly a bar, and the early afternoon crowd had a very loud guy dominating, which took away from what otherwise is a cozy, more tranquil place.  This became a proven observation after this guy left.  I did think the wine was a bit over priced at $7.50 - 9.50 per glass; but I did like how they had featured whites and reds, both selections were very good ones.  There was a cheaper house wine, Salmon (?) for $5.50/glass if you are on a budget.    Beer seemed high, but I do not remember how much it was. That said, they have a number of drafts, which are regularly changed, and lots of bottled beers.  I especially liked that they featured local beers.  We ate a snack of loaded chips ($8.75) and that was it.  The dinner menu looked like a heck of a lot more to offer than the daytime, so there is potential to check out Killingtons for dinner sometime.

H2qRG8Hm61E_vMX57gORDg.text: Fort Mill is welcoming more and more casual eateries. It's both wonderful and frustrating but only frustrating because I loved being able to say I live in a small town. Now, everyone knows Fort Mill.  Killington's is a newer spot that is located in what used to be, Beef O'Bradys. Frankly, they deserve a good review for replacing that joint and calling it a "joint" is really too polite; but I digress. With a menu of 'standouts', Killington's will be welcoming more and more guests as the seasons change and Baxter Village events pick up. Not too many places offer Pasta Purses or Mahi Caeser Wraps. Don't get me wrong, a twist on classics but still added flare.  The layout of the booths and tables is a bit odd but the added space to walk is nice. It's tough to find a restaurant that you don't feel cramped walking to the restroom, these days. Some places take Fire Department capacity limits to a whole new level... My boyfriend and I visited on a whim. So, I didn't have much time to flip through reviews prior to our visit. Doesn't mean I base all of my selections on a good or bad review, but I do like to have an idea of what my colleagues like or dislike. The tables were mostly full but there were a few open areas so we were seated immediately. They seemed well staffed and attentive to guest needs. I must admit, one thing truly bothered me. Our waitress left her name on a paper name plate. While I appreciate the reminder, as I'm not excellent with the first introduction, the concept is too, too much like Hooters. Something I'd suggest Killington's removes from their policies. Though it may just be my preference, my boyfriend acknowledged the oddity as well.  Otherwise, we had a pleasant experience. I'd score a 90 for cleanliness of the guest accessible areas (restroom included), 92 for service and 100 for the food. I did quite enjoy the pasta purses. My boyfriend devoured his Bayou Pasta and the bite I stole from his plate was worth his glare! We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Bayou Pasta
Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Cheese Pasta Purses with Tomato Basil Cream Sauce
Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Fried Ravioli Appetizer

ZeUj7qBGwd-XaOPbHFozAg.text: Nice little place.  Ordered the fish and chips with the wife and split it.  Fish was cooked perfect and the fries were great.  Didn't try any of the beers but had a good selection.  Would come back for sure.  Staff was friendly and attentive.

Chq2mqzhEQZbTj1bcpcCWQ.text: Yay Killingtons is closer then Huntersville! Open till midnight even serves til then. Friendly staff. Amanda bartender was super helpful, knowledgeable and shared her favorites of the menu. The Baxter chicken (substitute green beans for the spinach) yummmm and so much food! Green beans amazing flavor! Bayou pasta not spicy, great flavor, so much chicken. Couldn't finish the pasta had to take it home. Have you tried the Caesar salad? The best Caesar dressing I've had around.  Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Killingtons Restaurant & Pub - Fort Mill - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Baxter chicken

TdN9yaGnyfaIFb0MRapNSw.text: Had my first visit here on last night. Wonderful service, amazing atmosphere, and great food! The entire area is nice and I will be back.

q_Aille-rihjIBx2frkOPg.text: Brand new location in Fort Mill SC.  This is located where Beef o' Brady's use to be.    The inside has changed slightly with a casual atmosphere with plenty of seating located inside and out and has a nice bar area with three large screen TVs.  There are plenty of tv's to watch sports wherever you are seated.  Tonight we had the Killington's dip with fries, bowl of chili,  side salad, and a side of Parmesan green beans.  The service was fast, friendly, and our drinks were kept filled throughout the meal.    Kudos to the management and staff during the 2nd week in business....

tuIvC9LExbwMLccngDAfvA.text: First time to Killington's. Visited the old beef o Brady at this location for years.     Killingtons food was good.  Not great but good.    Prices are too high for the food type and quality.  Maybe they believe the Baxter young family crowd will bring their younger children and pay high prices ?       In summary.  Not bad food.  We had a couple of different salads.  Chili and a homemade chip cheese thingy.

csZ3lmP7wvT_0_r_xRTZhw.text: Lovely friendly staff and great food and drinks! Was greeted with a smile walking in!

0ZwVwnNLZpN68AqjO4-KPw.text: I've been to Killingtons a few times and the food and service were just average. We thought we'd give it another shot tonight, but upon entering a fairly empty restaurant at 5:00pm with my family (party of three) we were told by the host that there would be a 20-30 minute wait for a table. The restaurant was VERY empty, so I questioned why we couldn't be seated to which the host responded "I can seat you but it will be a while before anyone can help you. We are expecting several large parties tonight and we had a busy lunch".  Not sure what a "busy lunch" has to do with it but maybe the chef or servers needed a quick nap.   At this point, the manager/owner joined the conversation but said nothing to indicate that he was at all interested in accommodating us. Instead, he let three potential customers walk out of his near-empty restaurant.   We left and ate nearby and as we walked by Killingtons thirty minutes later, the restaurant was still nearly empty and the tables that were expected to be full were still vacant. The reality is that we could have been in and out long before their big parties even arrived.   Strikes one, two and three Killingtons. Done with you.
